title: Add a guided tutorial experience that walks a first-time user through building their first project.
summary: Implement a mission-style guided flow that overlays hints and progress steps across Stations for a first project.
instructions:
You are adding a guided tutorial system to help kids complete their first project in The Workshop.

Goal for this task:
Implement a mission-style guided flow that overlays hints and progress steps on top of the existing Stations, without locking the UI down too tightly.

Perform these steps:

1) Tutorial domain model
   - Create app/src/domain/tutorial.ts defining:
     - TutorialId type (for example 'first_project_robot_dog').
     - Step type containing:
       - id, title, description, targetStationKey, and optional targetElementId or hintPlacement.
     - TutorialState type with:
       - activeTutorialId, currentStepIndex, completedAt (optional).

2) Tutorial store
   - Create app/src/runtime/store/tutorialStore.ts:
     - Manage active tutorial state and progress.
     - Save tutorial progress to local storage (per user/device).
     - Expose methods:
       - startTutorial(id), nextStep(), prevStep(), completeTutorial(), resetTutorial(id).

3) Tutorial overlay UI
   - Implement a TutorialOverlay component under app/src/ui/tutorial/ that:
     - Observes tutorialStore.
     - Displays current step info: title, description, and what Station the user should visit.
     - Optionally highlights a target element (if targetElementId is available) or the Station in nav.
     - Provides Next/Back/Skip/Done controls.

4) First mission: Robot Dog Comic
   - Define a tutorial configuration for a simple default mission (for example Robot Dog Comic from the Atlas examples):
     - Steps that move through: Idea → Build → Test → Memory → Share.
     - Simple instructions at each step that map to actions the child can realistically take.
   - Hook this tutorial to a prominent 'Try a Guided Mission' button on the project selection or landing screen.

5) Boundaries and tone
   - Ensure tutorial hints are short, encouraging, and non-judgmental.
   - Allow users to exit the tutorial at any time without losing their project data.

Do not create a full mission editor yet. Focus on the data structures, store, overlay, and a single guided path.
acceptance_criteria: A tutorial domain model exists with TutorialId, Step, and TutorialState types.
tutorialStore manages active tutorial progress and persists it to local storage.
A TutorialOverlay component can show current step info and navigation controls, reacting to tutorialStore.
A 'Robot Dog Comic' style tutorial is available and can guide a user through Stations from project start to share.
Users can exit the tutorial at any time without losing project data.
